snippet: Former tools of combat — M-16 rifles, grenade launchers, silencers and more — are ending up in the armories of local police departments, often with little public notice.
abstract: Military armament, vehicles and equipment are being added to the armories of local police departments nationwide as Obama administration continues to wind down so-called 'long season of war'; windfall includes tens of thousands of machine guns along with hundreds of armored cars and aircraft, causing some to worry about blurring lines between police officers and soldiers.
lead_paragraph: Former tools of combat — M-16 rifles, grenade launchers, silencers and more — are ending up in the armories of local police departments, often with little public notice.

headline.main: War Gear Flows to Police Departments
headline.print_headline: Officer Friendly, in a Tank? War Gear Flows to Police Departments

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
